page.title: 02The development of Rochdale.
page.content: textile industry. With the Industrial Revolution however, the textile industry changed from domestic to factory manufacture. Soon cotton took over from wool and was the main fibre spun in the Rochdale area. Raw cotton was imported through the port of Liverpool. Rochdale became important mainly for the spinning branch of the industry. In common with other Lancashire towns, Rochdale has suffered badly from foreign competition. Many mills have closed ; although, the buildings are now used in some cases for other industrial purposes. There has been recent expansion of light industry in an attempt to compensate for the declining textile trade.
